ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour.
Half an hour during weeks when we had journal club, to read the articles.
two
0-1 to read the articles
During weeks with Journal Club - 1 hour.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The lectures are great! All of them are very impressive. But I hope the lunch could be better. We like pizza but can we change to something else?
I think it would have been more helpful for second years if the seminar was not before a required class we needed to take. Many times I was forced to leave early in order to make it on time to class.
It's useful but we do need some guidance on this
Good.

Though it's only been this one semester, I've enjoyed the speakers we've had thus far in the seminar series. The journal club has been a bit hit or miss, especially since there is little precedent. While it seems to be a valuable time, a lot of the student response has been rather lackluster, with little student participation. This is frustrating to see from my peers, but I don't know what can be done about that.

This seminar series had a very impressive group of speakers. A broad range of topics gave us a strong supplemental education about environmental health that I felt was really lacking in the course load for the semester.
I am enjoying the EHS seminar/journal club. I appreciate the overview of different areas of EHS.
The seminar series provided depth and breadth that supplemented coursework well. Sometimes, the seminars didn't feel very relevant and it was difficult to engage in the speaker's presentation.

Great guest lecturers who gave very interesting talks about a variety of different areas in environmental health. Only critique: Since the seminar takes place at noon, it would be nice if lunch would continue to be provided, but please, no more pizza!
Having Journal Club is helpful for being prepared for speakers' talks.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Excellent orgnizer
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Good.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Her introductions are great, but there isn't too much interaction besides that.

Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel is organized, articulate, and very helpful. I am very excited she is part of the EHS program during my enrollment. I think she will be a great asset to the program in the future and I am excited for next semester's speakers.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr Deziel worked really hard to provide us with some great speakers and I appreciate her enthusiam to work with us.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very helpful introduction to various environmental health topics.
Useful. But could be more related to basic research?
Yes I would recommend it.
The lectures are great, I've been trying to recruit a few friends to come. Hopefully some next year will be more widely attended.
A great addition to the already strong core curriculum of first semester.
This is an assortment of EHS lecturers designed to provide an overview of various areas of EHS. I would recommend this to anyone with an interest in EHS.
Overall, I enjoyed the seminars. My only complaint might be that I wish we had something other than every once in a while.
